image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: When Oprah Winfrey was 'in LOVE' with Trump: Republicans dig dirt and letter after DNC speech
item.description: Oprah Winfrey received strong backlash from MAGA supporters following her endorsement of Kamala Harris at the Democratic National Convention. Republicans circulated old videos and letters showing Oprah's past admiration for Donald Trump. Despite her earlier endorsements of Barack Obama, Hillary Clinton, Joe Biden, and Jon Fetterman, this is her first appearance at a political convention.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Five minutes after take off, aircraft crash-lands near school in Australia
item.description: A Piper PA-28 aircraft, carrying a man and a woman, faced engine failure just minutes after taking off from Bankstown Airport. The pilot executed an emergency landing near Bossley Park, leading to minor injuries for both occupants. The crash happened near a school, with the Australian Transport Safety Bureau now investigating the incident.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Sri Lanka threats on basic freedoms 'concerning': UN
item.description: The United Nations Human Rights Office on Thursday said basic freedoms in Sri Lanka were under threat, as the country gears up to elect a new president in September. "This trend is particularly concerning as the country is in an important pre-election period," UN Human Rights Chief Volker Turk said in a statement.

item.title: China opposes any country allowing Dalai Lama to visit: Foreign ministry
item.description: China has expressed opposition to countries allowing Dalai Lama visits, following his meetings with US state department and White House officials. The Chinese foreign ministry views the Dalai Lama as a separatist figure and urged the US to honor its commitments to China and cease interactions with the Dalai Lama group, stressing the anti-China nature of such activities.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Man opens aircraft's emergency exit, walks on wing at Australian airport
item.description: The incident took place when Jetstar Flight JQ507 arrived at Melbourne Airport from Sydney and parked at a terminal gate. The man exited the aircraft through the right-side emergency exit, officials informed.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: GOP defectors rally behind Kamala Harris, criticise Trump's 'cult-like' influence
item.description: At the Democratic convention, significant figures from both parties endorse Kamala Harris for the 2024 election. Some Republicans criticise Trump, highlighting concerns about his leadership and influence on the GOP. They urge Republicans and independents to view Harris as a viable alternative, portraying Trump as a danger to democracy.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Matthew Perry’s death: ‘Friends’ star’s bedroom a ‘disaster’ in final hours, described as a ‘long bender’ scene, claims report
Paraguay open to China trade deals despite Taiwan ties, Pena says
item.description: Paraguay's long-standing diplomatic support for Taiwan has hindered local farmers' grains exports to China, which claims sovereignty over the self-governed island. Paraguay is the only South American country with formal relations with Taiwan, which strongly objects to China's sovereignty claims.

item.title: Is Bill Clinton ill? Former US president's fragile DNC speech with trembling hands and raspy voice causes concern
item.description: Former President Bill Clinton, 78, spoke at the Democratic National Convention with noticeable signs of aging. He hinted that due to health concerns, this might be his last attendance. Clinton commended Vice Presidential nominee Tim Walz and outgoing President Biden. Using notes instead of a teleprompter, Clinton delivered his speech reflecting on his long history with the conventions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump terms Josh Shapiro 'highly overrated Jewish governor' after his freedom speech at DNC
item.description: Donald Trump launched a critique against Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro following Shapiro's Democratic National Convention comments. Trump branded Shapiro as 'highly overrated,' insisting that Shapiro disregarded his contributions to Israel. Trump also accused Vice President Kamala Harris of 'hating Israel,' a statement that critics have condemned as antisemitic. Shapiro dismissed Trump's claims.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I’m allergic to my period!': UK woman's struggle with a rare condition

item.title: Who is Gus Walz? The 17-year-old son of Tim Walz with learning disorder who stole the spotlight at DNC
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Did Queen Elizabeth really find Trump 'very rude'? The answer might surprise you
item.description: A former Buckingham Palace aide dismissed claims from an upcoming biography that Queen Elizabeth II found Donald Trump rude during his visits. The aide stated that the Queen had described Trump and his family as gracious and wonderful guests. The controversy arises from differing accounts about Trump's behavior and the Queen's impressions during state visits.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘That’s my dad!’: Tim Walz’s son Gus bursts into tears during father's emotional DNC speech
item.description: At the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Governor Tim Walz’s emotional speech on Thursday resonated with the audience, particularly his family. He accepted the vice presidential nomination, sharing personal struggles with infertility. His son Gus, 17, was moved to tears, highlighting the familial bond and the impact of Walz’s journey with fertility treatments.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Oprah Winfrey urges Americans to 'choose common sense over nonsense' in DNC speech, taking subtle jabs at Trump and Vance: Key points
item.description: Oprah Winfrey called for unity at the Democratic National Convention, subtly critiquing Donald Trump and JD Vance. She urged support for Kamala Harris and Tim Walz, emphasizing loyalty to the Constitution and common sense. Winfrey shared her personal reasons for speaking out, highlighting America's role in her success.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Pandit Rakesh Bhatt? Hindu priest who opened DNC Day 3 with vedic prayer
item.description: Pandit Rakesh Bhatt, a Hindu priest from Bengaluru, brought a spiritual touch to the Democratic National Convention in Chicago. He led a traditional Hindu prayer, emphasizing unity and justice through the Sanskrit concept of 'Vasudhaiva Kutumbakam.' Bhatt's involvement underscored themes of world peace and harmony, inspiring a sense of unity among the diverse attendees.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
